SEARCH
Package pl.polsl.lab1.krzysztof.gach.view

Class MessageBox

java.lang.Object
pl.polsl.lab1.krzysztof.gach.view.MessageBox
public class MessageBox extends Object
The MessageBox class provides utility methods for displaying various types of message dialogs, including information messages, warning messages, error messages, confirmation dialogs, and input dialogs.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Krzysztof Gach

  • Constructor Details

    • MessageBox

      public MessageBox(JFrame frame)
      Constructs a new MessageBox with the specified parent frame.
      Parameters:
      frame - The JFrame that will be the parent of the dialog boxes.

  • Method Details

    • showInfoMessage

      public void showInfoMessage(String message, String title)
      Displays an information message dialog.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to display.
      title - The title of the dialog.

    • showWarningMessage

      public void showWarningMessage(String message, String title)
      Displays a warning message dialog.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to display.
      title - The title of the dialog.

    • showErrorMessage

      public void showErrorMessage(String message, String title)
      Displays an error message dialog.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to display.
      title - The title of the dialog.

    • showConfirmDialog

      public boolean showConfirmDialog(String message, String title)
      Displays a confirmation dialog with Yes and No options.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to display.
      title - The title of the dialog.
      Returns:
      true if the user selects "Yes", false otherwise.

    • showInputDialog

      public String showInputDialog(String message, String title)
      Displays a dialog that prompts the user for a single line of input.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to display.
      title - The title of the dialog.
      Returns:
      The user input as a String, or null if the dialog is cancelled.

    • showTwoInputDialog

      public String[] showTwoInputDialog(String message1, String message2, String title)
      Displays a dialog that prompts the user for two lines of input.
      Parameters:
      message1 - The message for the first input field.
      message2 - The message for the second input field.
      title - The title of the dialog.
      Returns:
      An array of Strings containing the user inputs, or null if the dialog is cancelled.
